title: Adam Lallana in fight with Kasper Schmeichel and Jonny Evans during Liverpool's win vs Leicester City
text:
Adam Lallana was involved in a scuffle with Kasper Schmeichel and Jonny Evans (Twitter)

Adam Lallana triggered a confrontation with Kasper Schmeichel and Jonny Evans in the immediate aftermath of James Milner’s injury-time penalty against Leicester City.

Jurgen Klopp’s side extended their winning run at Anfield but faced a nervy second half as James Maddison cancelled out Sadio Mane’s opener with 10 minutes remaining.

But after Mane was brought down in the box, Milner stepped up in the 95th minute to secure a 2-1 victory for Liverpool.

After the full-time whistle, Andy Robertson was involved in an altercation with Leicester forward Ayoze Perez.

But subsequent footage has shown that Lallana was also at the centre of a heated exchange with Schmeichel and Evans.

After Milner had scored his penalty, Lallana grabbed the ball and got straight into a tussle with Schmeichel, who wrestled the ball away from him and threw it towards the centre spot.

Evans spotted the altercation between the pair and barged Lallana, who then threw his shoulder towards the Leicester centre-back.

Lallana was then pushed in the back by Evans’ centre-back partner Caglar Soyuncu.

The Liverpool midfielder then got involved with Robertson’s spat with Perez after the full-time whistle.

Both sets of players continued their heated exchange in the tunnel.
